commands Package¶

commands Package¶

This package offers a way for convenient registration of custom commands. By calling its register() method, a formal representation of a command syntax can be bound to a handling function desired to be called for user input matching said command. Functions intended to serve as handlers, when declared like def func(*args, **kwargs) have access to their command’s arguments marked by surrounding angle brackets (<>).

The internal representation of the resulting command language can be found in the cmdict member of this module, which resembles a syntax tree in which by traversing down along a command syntax’ terms, the thereby reached leafe refers to the corresponding handler function.

Example:

>>> import commands
>>> def handler(*args, **kwargs):
...     name = kwargs.get("graphname") # or = args[0]
...     [...]
...
>>> commands.register("create <graphname>", handler)
Registered handling function handler('args', [...]
>>> commands.cmdict
{'create': {'<graphname>': {'': <function handler at 0x86c26f4>}}}

Alternativley, one can also use the @cmd_handler decorator provided by the kathaireo package itself and implemented at register_handler():

from kathaireo import cmd_handler
@cmd_handler
def handler(*args, **kwargs):
        """`create <graphname>`"""
        [...]

...does the same as the snippet above.

kathaireo.commands.choices_left(input, csrange)[source]¶

Assembles a list of terms that allow a valid input line given the prefix passed as input has been typed in so far. Those terms can include command keywords and argument values and depend on the command syntax to which the input line so far typed in matches, as well as legal argument values for that incomplete input line. The resulting list will only contain keywords or argument values that either have been started typing in, or those that may legally extend the current prefix, in case the latter doesn’t end with an incomplete keyword or argument value.

kathaireo.commands.cmdict = {'load': {'<resource>': {'': <function parse_rdf at 0x39b6b18>, '<graphname>': {'': <function parse_rdf at 0x39b6b18>}}, 'namespaces': {'': <function import_namespaces at 0x39b6e60>, '<graphname>': {'': <function import_namespaces at 0x39b6e60>}}}, 'insert': {'<graphname>': {'into': {'<graphname>': {'': <function merge_graph at 0x39b6de8>}}}}, 'use': {'<graphname>': show_graphs at 0x39b6aa0>}, 'commands': {'': <function ls_cmd at 0x39bc848>}, '<graphname>': {'<attribute>': {'': <function graph_info at 0x39b6b90>}}}, 'bind': {'<namespace>': {'<nsurl>': {'': <function bind_ns at 0x39b6cf8>, '<graphname>': {'': <function bind_ns at 0x39b6cf8>}}}}, 'create': {'<graphname>': {'': <function create_graph at 0x39b69b0>, 'store': {'sqlite': {'<sqlite>': {'': '<graphname>': {'': <function find_term_ls at 0x39b6c80>}}}, 'commands': {'': <function ls_cmd at 0x39bc848>}, 'ls': {'': <function show_graphs at 0x39b6aa0>, 'ns': {'': <function show_ns at 0x39b6c08>, '<namespace>': {'': <function show_ns at 0x39b6c08>}}, '<graphname>': {'': <function find_term_ls at 0x39b6c80>}}}¶

Assembles a tree (more precisely: a forest) of which each path that leads from a root all the way down to a leaf, stands for a legal command.

kathaireo.commands.execute(input)[source]¶

Tests given input string against currently registered command syntaxes. If input turns out to be a valid command, a corresponding handler function is called. If matching syntax contains argument placeholders (“command <arg>”), their respective values are extracted from the input and passed to the handler function.

kathaireo.commands.init()[source]¶

Read, compile and register default commands. These are those contained by default_cmds plus those defined by the commands.stdcmd module, parse docstrings of all functions in handlers namespace for command ... syntax specifications and register() those that have some.

kathaireo.commands.msg_incomplete_cmd(keywords)[source]¶

Returns a helpful error message in case an input string didn’t contain a complete command, and the parser had still been expecting upcoming content at the time of termination.

kathaireo.commands.register(syntax, function)[source]¶

Inserts the given command’s syntax into a known commands dictionary and registers the given function as its handler.

Parameters:
  • syntax –

    A String containing a formal representation of a new command’s syntax. A command syntax may contain argument identifiers s.t. the handling function (and shell-features like autocomplete) has access to argument variables passed to a command. A command syntax string indicating a handler’s capability of processing command arguments would look something like this, for instance:

    'command option <arg1> <arg2> someswitch <arg3>'
  • function –

    A function intended to be called when said command is to be executed. Should accept an unlimited number of both positional and keyword arguments and is hence recommended to look sth like the following:

    >>> def func(*args, **kwargs):
...    [...]

    Note that nonetheless, it is not tested for fitting this requirement, but one might get in trouble when ignoring it.
Returns:

True, if function was successfully bound to command syntax, False, if command syntax is already in registry.
kathaireo.commands.register_handler(func)[source]¶

Decorator for command handler functions. Function will be copied into commands.handlers and, if their docstring contains a command syntax, registered as a handler for matching input.

arguments Module¶

The arguments module keeps track of command argument usage.

On the one hand, it keeps track of proper values from user input fitting argument placeholders in typed-in commands. Every argument placeholder thus has its own input history.

On the other hand, each argument placeholder gets equipped with two properties to impose requirements on its legal values with: the propose() function provides a suggestions list of possible values that may replace the placeholder, and can be used for like autocompletion. The format list contains regular expressions determining what input values are allowed.

class kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator(name)[source]¶

Container class for the two main validity specifiers an argument identifier can be assigned to: an autocompletion candidate proposal function (default one is propose_default()) and a format list of regular expressions for checking value validity.

propose(prefix)[source]¶

Calls this instance’s value proposal handler and returns all suggestions for the given input prefix.

validate(str)[source]¶

Tests validity of a given string according to this argument’s value restrictions.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.arghist = {'sqlite': [], 'resource': [], 'rdfrelation': [], 'attribute': [], 'namespace': [], 'filename': [], 'rdfentity': [], 'nsurl': [], 'graphname': []}¶

Dictionary object in which lists of previously submitted values are stored under assigned argument identifiers.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.argvals = {'sqlite': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5e60>, 'resource': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5e18>, 'rdfrelation': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39bb050>, 'attribute': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5f80>, 'namespace': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5f38>, 'filename': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39bb098>, 'rdfentity': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39bb170>, 'nsurl': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5fc8>, 'graphname': <kathaireo.commands.arguments.ArgValidator instance at 0x39b5ef0>}¶

Directory of registered argument identifiers, each one referencing their assigned ArgValidator instance.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.get_suggestions(name, prefix)[source]¶

calls an argument placeholder’s propose() handler function and returns resulting suggestions.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.graph_attrs(arg, prefix)[source]¶

Returns a list of names matching the given prefix and identifying RDF graphs registered by the rdf module.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.list_files_rdf(arg, prefix)[source]¶

Returns a list of local files with extensions .rdf, .owl, .n3 and .xml, matching given prefix.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.list_files_sqlite(arg, prefix)[source]¶

Returns a list of local files with extensions .sqlite and .sqlite3.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.ls_ns(arg, prefix)[source]¶

Returns currently loaded namespaces.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.ls_ns_urls(arg, prefix)¶

Namespace locators for <nsurl> arguments.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.ls_rdf_ent(arg, prefix)¶

Returns rdf entities (classes, properties).

kathaireo.commands.arguments.lsdir(prefix, filetypes)[source]¶

List contents of whatever directory can be dereived from given prefix. Result contains subdirectories and files whose extensions and names match the prefix. filetypes are passed as a list of globs (['*.rdf', '*.owl', ...]).

kathaireo.commands.arguments.propose_default(arg, prefix)[source]¶

Default function for argument value proposal. Looks up previous values for this argument and suggests those that match the given prefix. Can be overwritten under this premise.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.register(name, proposer=<function propose_default at 0x39b4d70>, format=None)[source]¶

Registers an argument placeholder. This means, for an arguments name/identifier, a user input history and an ArgValidator instance are created.

The latter is responsible for suggesting appropriate input values for this argument (which might be useful in features like autocompletion) and for determining wheather a given value is legal for this argument (like variable names are not meant to start with a number, urls must satisfy a certain format, and stuff like that.).

If an argument has been registered before, no changes are made unless a custom proposal function or a list of regular expressions is being passed in this call.

Parameters:
  • name – identifier of argument to register
  • proposer –

    input value proposal handling function for this argument (optional). This will be called when autocompletion recognizes that someone is about to input a value for this argument and wants assistance. Any function meant to serve as a proposal handler must take exactly two parameters:

    1. the argument placeholder identifier,
    2. the prefix that needs to be autocompleted
kathaireo.commands.arguments.resolve_local_url(url)¶

Converts from file:/// URL to absolute path.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.to_history(arg, value)[source]¶

Write a value to an argument’s input history stored in arghist.

kathaireo.commands.arguments.validate(arg, input)[source]¶

Validates given input string according to specified argument’s value restrictions. Return true if input is ok.

handlers Module¶

Contains implementations of handler functions for standard commands in interactive shell mode.

Functions intended to serve as handlers, when declared like def func(*args, **kwargs), can be registered using the commands module:

>>> commands.register("create <graphname>", handler)
kathaireo.commands.handlers.add_stm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Add triple. handles: add <rdfentity> <rdfrelation> <rdfentity> add <rdfentity> <rdfrelation> <rdfentity> <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.bind_ns(*args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new namespace binding in the current graph. handles: bind <namespace> <nsurl> bind <namespace> <nsurl> <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.cp_graph(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create new graph by given name and clone contents of another graph into it. handles: cp <graphname> <graphname> cp <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.create_graph(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates a new rdf.rdflib.Graph instance going by the identifier passed as first argument.

Parameters:identifier – Id for the new Graph
Returns:The resulting rdflib.Graph instance when successful, None otherwise.

handles: create <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.extract_cmd_syntax(fname)[source]¶

Extract command syntax definition from handler function docstring. :param fname: the function’s name. Expected to be known by this () module, either because the function’s implementation in the module source code anyway, or due to previous calls of commands.register_handler() invoked by the @cmd_handler decorator.

kathaireo.commands.handlers.find_term_ls(*args, **kwargs)¶

Find triples with the given term. handles: find <rdfentity> find <rdfentity> <graphname> ls <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.graph_info(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Display information about certain rdf graph. Possible keywords: size, ...

kathaireo.commands.handlers.import_namespaces(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Download namespaces for given graph name.

kathaireo.commands.handlers.merge_graph(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

merge graph into rdf.current_graph. handles: merge <graphname> insert <graphname> into <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.parse_rdf(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Parses the resource at a given location and reads it into a rdflib.Graph identified by its name.

Parameters:
  • location – A String specifying the location of the resource to be read. Can be a path to a local file or a URL.
  • graphname – A String identifying an rdflib.Graph instance.
Returns:

True, if parsing was successful.

handles: load <resource>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.quit(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simply calls exit().

kathaireo.commands.handlers.set_graph(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Select default graph for rdf operations. handles: use <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.show_graphs(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a list of strings representing all graph instances currently registered. handles: show graphs list ls

kathaireo.commands.handlers.show_ns(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

List loaded namespaces. handles: ls ns list namespaces ls ns <namespace> ls ns <graphname>

kathaireo.commands.handlers.store_sqlite(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Set sqlite as store for graph.

kathaireo.commands.handlers.store_xml(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Save contents of a graph to an xml file.

stdcmd Module¶

Bindings between command handler functions and command syntaxes.
